entries.meaning: (nautical) The angle that a bowsprit makes with the horizon, or with the line of the vessel's keel.
A spar, with a block at one end, used in stowing cotton bales and similar cargo needing to be packed tightly.

verbs.description: steeve (third-person singular simple present steeves, present participle steeving, simple past and past participle steeved)

entries.meaning: (archaic) To project upward, or make an angle with the horizon or with the line of a vessel's keel; said of the bowsprit, etc.
(transitive) To stow, as bales in a vessel's hold, by means of a steeve.
